Replies.Reply: It's me. It's Ali... I left. I took the kid with me. She can't take care of him anymore.
Yeah! Where is it? Shit! It's so far! How do I get there? I don't know. Today or tomorrow. Yeah...
I don't know. A big street that started at the station. Yeah, by the beach. Behind? We just came from there!
So am I. He's coming to pick us up. Come on!
She didn't remember anything. It was already in there. She forgot about it, that's all.
No answer. Sam is watching TV.
It's not too much, but I don't have it. I had to pay for the train...
I don't know. Find a job. Whatever.
What should I have done with the kid? Where should I have gone?
No need to cry. I wouldn't have left you all alone.
What do you like the most at Auntie's?
Is that all? Nothing else besides the dogs?
The dogs and the truck. The house? Auntie?
I worked in a slaughterhouse. Not for long.
Yeah. I was a night watchman in a stadium for 6 months. Working for the city. In a parking lot too. I did replacements.
Karate, for 6 years. I even won Junior Division. And two years of boxing. Thai.
It was my trainer who gave up.
Are you okay? Breathe out of your mouth. In and out. Put your head back. Walk a little.
You can't drive like that. I'll call you a cab.
Still bleeding? Keep your head back. Wait...
You often go to the Fever?
You're dressed like that just for dancing?
Dressed like that, it's no surprise that...
Don't worry. Got any ice at your place?
Is that you in the picture with the orcas?
number if ever you need it...
You're gross! You stink! Who's taking care of you?
Aren't you supposed to be taking care of him? What the fuck are you up to?
Don't go in there. It's disgusting. You hear?
Okay, then I'll be getting back.
Yeah, but nights are tough. I'm a security guard now. Three nights a week.
Have you been living here long?
Are you alone? You got no one to help you?
No, for the cleaning and everything...
Should we go to the ocean?
You don't have a bathing suit?
Who the fuck cares? There's no one here!
You swim like a real pro!...
I'm still at the gym. I'm leaving... I said I'm leaving!
There's something I don't get: how much do you take?
And how much does your cousin give you?
Sam! Come here! I want to show you some stuff!
Look at him, in red. See how strong he is?
No, he's the bad guy. Look how he tries to grab his legs. Wait.
I don't know. Look and tell me who wins.
So? What did he say? Which others? How many?
What is this bullshit? What do you mean, a tournament?
Tell him to give the website to his mother.
He's changing the rules and so am I... I couldn't care less.
You're such a pain in the ass.
Stop it now! I said stop! Calm the fuck down!
Cut it out, dammit! You're such a pain!
No, just fists I think. We bash each other's faces and whoever's still standing at the end wins. Hey, you're strangling me!
Risk my health? What are you talking about?
You can give it to me if you have too much money, but I said I was doing it and I am.
I didn't say it's not for the money!
Oh, stop driving me crazy! I'm doing it to fight. For fun. Why did you clown around on your fish? For the fun of it, right?
Spare me. You turn on the waterworks when you feel like it.
Motherfucker's acting like he's on Canal Plus.
I don't know. Guys with money. Dealers.
Okay. And the bets? How much is there?
Pull over here. I'll go rinse off my face.
Cut the shit. He's not dead. I didn't do it on purpose. I'm sorry about it.
Money. What I owe you plus the next few  65         months. You can count it.
Hey, will you take the money or not? Why are you looking at me that way?
You want to go for a swim?
I need to find a coach. A real one. Someone who has me work on my takedowns.
Foued doesn't know jackshit. Just jiu-jitsu and rap stuff. You need to ask Cousin. His guys must train somewhere.
Yeah. And I'll need some time to train.
Where are you? I can't see you. Where?
That's fucking amazing! I was looking for a wheelchair...
No, I don't know. You're like before.
It must be like walking on stilts...
You look taller. Does it hurt?
Want to go for a swim?
you have a lot of boyfriends?
How do you go about it?
You want to know if it still works, so let's fuck and that way you'll know.
Whatever you want... You tell me...
Maybe you should stop talking now...
Are you okay? How was it?
Yeah but I don't have time right now. I have to go!
But did you enjoy it or not?
When you're up for it and you can't find anyone, ask me. If I'm oper, we'll do it.
Operational... If I'm available. If I can, I mean!
You don't want to get going?
You freak her out. Can't you see? She feels like a cashier with you. Pathetic with her tea and cookies. It's a pain.
... All of a sudden, in your mouth, it's like it tasted like bone. A taste of rust and bone.
What do you want me to say?
You're pissing me off. What's your problem?
How am I looking at you?
What are you talking about, fucking or fighting?
You made me oper. It's you! It's because it's all you're talking about!
Aren't you being an ass by putting words everywhere?
So are you going to Strasbourg?
Yeah. And when do I see him?
What the hell is going on?
Shit... But what's the problem if I eat here?
Tell her I can't help out for the time being but that as soon as I have a little money...
You can go. But not too far!
Come on, we have to head back!
Okay. He woke up an hour ago.
I fucked up my hands on the ice.
He was in a coma for 3 hours... Three hours... For three hours he was dead... I was scared to lose him.
Wake up, kiddo. It's over. We're going home.
Stop it, Dad! It's cold. Stop!
Why is the red one the bad guy? Daddy?
Leave me alone. They're my babies!
Let go of me! Let go!
Yeah, in the cage. They lay eggs.
But Auntie doesn't want me to take the chicks in my room.
ask "You Ali?" again. This time I didn't even understand what he answered. Another few hundred feet... Ten of them! Ten! Every Kraut and Flemish guy on the coast! So I go call your sister...
What? You don't like my truck?

We all got fired after some Spanish guy bought out the trucking company... Eight truckers. I thought it over, discussed it with your sister and figured I could do it on my own. So I bought this truck with my severance pay...
Oops, poor man, not those! She'll kill you!
Look who it is! Go on, honk!
We're going to school. Want to come along?
Calm down. Calm down, I said!
Take your stuff and get out of here. We don't want to see you around here anymore.
I can't come in any further or I won't be able to get back out!
Bosses, in fact. I'm back to being exploited.
Got everything? Your bag, your coat, your hat, your mittens? You haven't forgotten anything? Now give me a kiss.
She found a job at a school cafeteria. She seems to enjoy it.
Yes. She says it's good for the kid.
Keep us posted if you win.
Yeah, right... Okay, I'm off. I'll deliver my load in Colmar and pick up the kid at around 7, okay?
Here. She wants to talk to you.
Is this all you have for him?
How will you tend to the kid? I won't be able to all the time. I work, and so does Richard... Was he in school there?
You don't know if your kid's in school?
Back at your mom's place, did you go to school?
I can try to enroll him at the school. I'll see... We also need to get him some clothes.
Careful. Don't step on their tiny paws.
The breeder's picking them up next month. Brings in some money. Otherwise, Richard and I were thinking 300 a month for you and the kid... That okay?
So what are you going to do?

Yeah, whatever... You think there's any work around here? You think there's any more here than there? Where has that ever been the case? When you told me you were coming down,  8         I said we couldn't afford houseguests!
I have no idea, but if you stay here you have to pay your share, or else go somewhere else. As far as we're concerned, it's easy: we can't! How long were you thinking of staying?
Keep Sam with you for 5 minutes!
Oh! Hear me? I don't want your son in the garden.
What the hell? I asked you to watch him for 5 minutes!
He's taking them to the country.
What are you doing? Are you his father or not?
Don't talk to me like that!
Don't touch him! Don't touch him I said! You know what? You're... you're a bad person.
You see what you're like with him? You're not around and when you are, you scream at him. Damn, you hit him! Why did you take him along if you act like that? You should have left him.
A fight? What kind of fight? Is that the only job you could find?
I didn't know you were here. You scared me.
You bring girls back to my place now?
They were out of grapefruit. I took tropical fruit.
I'll make tea. I have some cookies. You drink tea, don't you?
I was fired this morning. I'm unemployed.
They had cameras in the storeroom... They filmed us when we took the expired food.
You had your sister fired. How does it feel?
You couldn't know? You couldn't know what?
Go to your room. Go upstairs immediately.
In his message he said he was in Strasbourg.
If I had an address or a number, I'd give it to you... Even if I think it's dumb. Do you believe me?
After what he did to me...
He abandoned his kid. He doesn't give a fuck about anything. All he ever cared about was himself. He's totally selfish.
Me? What did you expect with him?
Unzip your jacket! Empty your pockets!
No criminal record? You never fucked up?
Is that the truth? We'll be checking anyway...
And how are you physically? You stay in shape?
Okay, I'll let you through because I'm outnumbered. Four against one, I don't stand a chance!

You say something nice, anything. That way, when they leave, they remember you and you can hit on them. If they're a little plastered, if things didn't go too well for them, you're there with a nice thing to say...
Sometimes. But you can't be dressed like that. Like a parking lot attendant...
I have to get back. I need to train.
The Cousin's waiting for you inside. Table to the left of the bar.
He saw me at la Ciotat. We spoke a few times on the phone. When he has it in for you, he never lets up. Leonardini is well-known.
What do you think? I'd be an idiot...
Mr. Leonardini, this is my buddy Ali. Ali Van Versh.
No, I came alone. I have my car in the lot.
I'm fine. I'm fine, I said. Thanks.
How do I get my car afterwards? Seriously, I'll be fine. Trust me!
I don't believe this. Pull over here!
Stop this car on the double!
It's MY car! If I tell you to stop, you stop!
Wait here. I'll be right back.
The bouncer from the Fever. He drove me home.
We decided to go out for a drink after.
Not orcas. Just one orca. Her name is Niska.
That what? A whore could train whales? Well, you see...
With that guy who dropped me off. I saw your face. I saw how you piped down.
what I should do, how I should live my life.
Don't give me any more orders, that's all.

No, Louise, there are lots of things you can say but not that. The pools are my responsibility and all I care about are the animals. I have to see to their environment and that starts with their trainers. Do you understand?
You're not consistent. We've already discussed that. The foundation of the relationship with the orcas is stability.
Okay, are you done? We can stop here. No need to spoil the rest of your internship.
Stop it, calm down. I'm fine!
My legs! What did you do with my legs?
No, it's the grass. I'll stop...
It's Stephanie. Remember me? We met at the Fever.
You know what happened to me?
How do you think I am?
I'm... crazy busy too. Every day and every night. I don't know how to manage...
Was that you who rang before?
Want something to drink? A coffee?
I don't know... Three or four months.
Yeah there are people. They come and go.
I don't know. You're the one who wanted to go out...
Stop it. I want to puke.
Do you realize what you're saying?
Actually I think I will go in.
You have to carry me. Help me...
Don't let me go! Not right away... Do it gently.
I can't stop. If I do, I sink. Wait...
Let go of me! Stop, I can manage alone.
I can do the seat belt!
Don't you have something simpler, classier?
I don't know... like a wooden leg with a piece of rubber at the end?
Or just a plank. A plank with wheels and straps. And irons to move forward with.
And that works? If you tell them you're with me, do they let you do what you want?
Cool. If ever you want a day off, just tell me. I'll write you a note.
What kind of boxing? Thai? Do you use your feet?
Is it the first time you're doing this?
How much do they pay you for this?
You're going to get whacked on the face and risk your health for 500 euros?
I'll give you the 500! Cancel it and I'll give it to you tomorrow.
If it's not for money, why then?
Yeah and look how I ended up.
Your fight, if you do it...
You think I can come along?
Keep this on it. It's the only one I have.
Put this on it. It's the only one I have.
What do you want to know? If I knew him before the accident?
You find it weird that we're together? You wonder what he's doing with me?
Why are you giving me that?
Exactly. So why give it to me?
I need to get my balance but supposedly that doesn't take long.
I don't know. I've never walked on stilts before.
A little, but it feels good too.
The beach... pff, I don't know... It's different today... I don't think I want to get undressed.
Look in the fridge. There must be some cheese left.
No, I don't have any pate.
You're a good eater, aren't you?
There are crackers up there. Do you have a girlfriend?
No, there were others. But not a lot either.
Um, nothing. I don't even know what it looks like anymore... I don't even know if it still works...
Did I say I didn't want to anymore? Of course I still want to...
How do you think I go about it? If I were a guy I'd say I jerk off to a porn video...
I... I don't know if I can like that...
Do you mind if we don't kiss?
Um, yes... no... I don't really know. It's different... It's hard to tell after just one try...
No, no! That's not what I meant... I just meant that it's too soon to tell... like too many things are happening at once...
Louise? Louise, are you here? Is anyone here?
I stopped by the office but there wasn't anyone.
When I feel like it, I send him a text message and ask if he's oper. If he is, we hook up.
If he's up for it. If he's free. If he is, we fuck.
Yes, that's all. What else do you want?
No. Illicit fights in the projects.
Whatever I say, you make a face.
Don't bother. This is perfect, I swear.
So this is where you sleep? It's a nice room.
Why are you looking at me like that? Does it scare you? You want to see them, is that it?
Because you think bone has a taste?
Yes, sure but.... I don't know anything about that scene... I don't know those guys!
How do I do the bets?
Honestly, can you see me dealing with those beasts?
Was the insurance money your idea?
Yeah... where else would it be?
No. And I don't want anything to happen to it. Now more than ever!
No... No, please. I don't feel like it. Not tonight. I can't...
It's best I go. Good night and thanks.
I can't remember. Afterwards the cousin took us to a club at la Colle sur Loup... It sucked and it was 5 a.m. And you?
You think it's good that we're having this conversation?
That I ask how it was with the girl last night and you answer normal.
"Oh la" what? You think it's normal leaving with that bimbo in front of me? What would you say if I did the same thing?
Wait, let me put it differently. What I am for you? A friend? A pal?
Tell me something: do you and your buddies fuck every now and then?
Dammit, stop looking at me that way!
You wanted us to continue... Isn't that what you told Martial?
Well, we have to go about it well. We have to show each other manners, and consideration...
Hey! Stop acting like an idiot. Do the words bother you? You know what I mean.... Tact...
We'll continue... but not like animals.
Are you acting like a jackass on purpose?
I don't like it when you see me like this...
There's a gala in Turin next week. He told me that we'd have time to meet there. I'm going to go.
Turn on the water when you pee. It's disgusting.
Can you get me a ticket for tonight?
An accident. In another life. I was an animal trainer. I worked with orcas... The show took a turn for the worse.
You mean in general? In my life?
I'm not asking for anything. I'll be going.
What the hell? What's going on?
The Fever? What the hell were you doing there?
If you decide to go out, call me. That's all! Who were you with there?
I thought you went out to dinner.
You get my text messages? Why didn't you answer me?
Okay, are you done now? Can you leave us alone?
Are you okay? Are you upset?
What are you trying to make me believe, that I wasn't up to par?
You know this has nothing to do with my internship. You couldn't care less if I was competent or not! It has to do with that I fucked Michael. Just say so.

And in fact what really bothers you is not that we fucked, but that he told me about you. How you think you're so... How you've become such a bitch. That's why you're firing me. That's what you should write in your report.
Tom and Niska... They got in each other's way.
I stopped by your place. I saw the cleaning woman. She didn't want me to pay her. She was... in shock. She's scared to come here.
Shit, you're not ready! The appointment is in a half hour!
What do you mean? You're a freaking pain! I have to get back to work. Come on, let me help you.
Oh yeah? Okay, so manage then!
Can't you call them to tell them we're going to be late?
I've had enough of your schtick, you hear me?
I told them I was with you.
I don't know. Is that enough?
Just give me a second to react... Are you in love?
I was next doing the laundry.
I'll put him in the shower.
There was an accident at Marineland.

I spoke to your brothers. They wanted to talk to you but I didn't think it was the right time. We'll all come with Hugo during the next school break... I was afraid I might lose you. I don't know what I'd have  30         done... It may seem selfish. In any case, you've always done whatever you wanted. But this time I was so scared that I don't think I'll ever be scared again.
Hugo wanted to say goodbye to you. We're leaving tomorrow but we'll pray for you, honey.
Want me to tell you something?
You haven't finished mourning, that's all!
They were a part of you. When a man dies, he gets buried. There's a ceremony, a prayer...
You have to think about it symbolically...
I know where my arm is. We buried it under a nice oak tree behind my house in the scrubland. My wife and kids came and we sang...
A HyperBrico DIY store in an industrial zone in Cannes. Its windows shine in the night like an aquarium.
She looks back and, between the seats, notices the girl toying with Raphael's fly.
Imagine you're the manager of a big store like this and the union reps have been busting your balls. What do you do?
You think that's how it works? What do you do before you fire them?

Well, beforehand you try to see how long they spend in the restroom, if they take extra-long coffee breaks, smoke on the premises, steal from the stockroom, rip customers off with the sales receipts...
Walk down the aisle. No, further down, like you came out of that door there. Good, perfect...
He says he's done Thai boxing. He can fight.
Oh, I introduced you to him, didn't I? How's that?

Last one standing gets the money. I know, but he says it's better that way. Do you think you're in a position to negotiate a percentage? Where did you get that idea from? He gave me a website if you want to see the others.
It's okay. Let's go. Fall against the big one in black shorts. I told you. They're big guys.
A little over 2000 for the time being. But it'll go up during the final match.
If you get into trouble, don't insist, just fall.
Have you known him for long?
No, since you know him, I just wanted to know if you've seen him like that before?
Hey, you make it complicated. Either you take it or you don't. And either I talk or I keep my mouth shut.
Normal. This one is for the equipment.
I have to watch this. Have a seat.
I'll talk with Alta Secu. We'll be able to work something out.
I'll have my company pay you and I'll bill them what you cost me. They'll keep paying you but now you'll work directly for me. You won't have to spend your nights there.
I'll make a copy and you'll take it to the  69         owner. Ask for Steve at Security. He'll tell you what to do.
Go get the equipment. I need to see him.
Forget it. Let's get out of here!
Forget about it. We're fucked here. The cops are going to question the managers and the managers will turn us in.
I have to go away for work. 3 or 4 months, I don't know yet... Since Ali wants to keep fighting, I thought maybe you tend to that while I'm not here...
He's the one who asked me to call you.
I wrote it all down here. As for the rest, ask me your questions and I'll answer them.
You can count on your fingers, can't you?
And you need money to cover the bets, and you have money.
What? You're not rich? What did the insurance company give you for your legs?
It's me, I said. Don't worry. I'm the bad guy.
It's fine. The boss told me he was coming.
Look at the next one! Watch how he whacks him.
... I know him. I fought him twice in Nationals. He's not bad.
We'll order two pairs of prosthetic devices, one for everyday life and one for the sport you do.
What do you mean by classier?
No, sorry. We don't make those models anymore.
10 more minutes, just to make sure. Then Doctor Vitias will come for you.
We'll take care of you. Come with me.
Is that true? You like to fight?
Okay, so I organize the fights. I pick the fighters. I see if the money's there. I ref.
There's something I'd like to know... The fish that ate your legs...
Is it true it's still there?
They didn't shoot it? Or put it down, whatever?
I don't know... when a dog attacks you, they kill it. And the fish gets off. Don't you mind that the thing that ate your legs is living it up in its shitty fucking aquarium?
"Now more than ever". Listen to you!
Don't bother. We're the ones who will call the police. The police and the press. That way they'll know you spy on your workers!
At least have the courage to look at me when I talk to you!
Why shouldn't I? You film us!
No problem. What are you drinking?
Come on. There's something we want to show you.
